## Background

Infectious diseases can spread rapidly accross the world and can be caused by germs such as bacteria, viruses, fungi and parasites. 

Environmental factors influence the disease transmission and affect different populations having variety of living conditions. 

- water supply
- sanitation facilities
- food
- climate


---

## Introduction 
- Dataset of incetious diseases outbreaks collected from WHO
- COVID-19 affected 562 million people worldwide
- SARS-Cov in 2003, severe acute respiratory syndrome
- Influenza A (H1N1) in 2009-2010, pandemic 

**The increasing number of different outbreaks raises awareness.**

- All information used is based on epidemiological, clinical and laboratory inverstigations by health authoriries
